assessments.note: He is proposing an off-internet/PC full blockchain portable solution…… although I fail to see what it is a solution to. He was frequently asked in the comments section for use cases, that he has failed to supply. So at this point the answer is No, I fail to see how this will bring more Defi  teams to build/deploy open finance solutions on Cardano.

Clearly there is some tech in this proposal, however what problem it solves is unclear. The proposal would benefit by providing a clear description of what problem this solves, who it solves it for, how big the problem it is, and how it would address the goals of the Scale-Up of the DeFi ecosystem.
How does producing hardware Daedalus nodes meet the challenge goal?

In my opinion this proposal is a real implementation that could improve the transactions volume on Cardano blockchain, but It isn't clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for users, traders and so on.. ). However the objective of the proposal is very interesting. The prototype is nice and funny, built with a lot of passion. I think there is a value for the customers, in security and simplicity

"Daedalus Wallet Node SBC Devices" is an ambitious hardware/software development project; however, the proposal has no relationship to Decentralized Finance, which is focused on autonomous marketplaces for financial services.

It's very unclear what problem this is trying to solve. For the masses, a light node is enough. For enthousiasts, running a node on their computer, optionnaly with a Ledger is a good solution. What is the point of having a dedicated hardware for a node? How does it scale up DeFi?

He states his experience is 'MCSE. 30 years of code work. Make my own equipment and programming' – I've omitted the rest because it is not relevant – There is no evidence to back this up. There are also  no details of the App developers and so I cannot judge whether that the App or the hardware will be created successfully.
The plan itself just looks like he has just thrown it all at the page and hoped some of it sticks!! It feels like he has written down his thought process and then straight copy and pasted into the proposal, it is not clear and concise, has no real flow and so is very confusing. 
The proposal is in an unfinished format that does not instill me with a large amount of confidence that this will be carried out successfully. If he is indeed serious about this proposal then I think it should be tidied up and placed in the correct challenge, I also suggest that the monetary amount is reduced by spreading it over more than one fund cycle.

The proposal appears to plan to have a group of community members begin using an alternative network as a key part of bringing adoption to the product. However based on the insulting remarks made by the proposer in the comments, there is possibility that a community will not form around the proposal and it risks destroying the outlook of the proposal.
Possible the proposer can meet this goal. How are the physical units being sold/distributed?

The proposal team is completed skilled and have a good technical knowledge and expertise, so in my opinion will able to make surely a good product in production. In relation to the possible success of the initiative, there are poor indications related to marketing and communication for the product launch, neither about the customers adoption. Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or capital risk

As with the above comments I do not think that this proposal should be within this challenge as I fail to see how this will bring more Defi  teams to build/deploy open finance solutions on Cardano in the next 6 months.

While the proposal includes a demonstration of a working bit of tech, it doesn't include a clear path to building the community which is required to get this to work. To address feasibility the proposal should identify a target market of early adopters with concrete data points which demonstrate how much demand there is for this type of product.
No clear measure of how this meets the challenge.

The proposer doesn't provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon, so what is the plan forward and roadmap? In my opinion it's not clear and well detailed what exactly is the problem statement and value of the solution to scale-up DeFi. The proposal doesn't offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation

As stated by the proposer "successful consideration is difficult to understand." Indeed. The proposee demonstrates a high degree of technical expertise and great enthusiasm for the Cardano ecosystem. To achieve a better proposal, which is easier for an audience to understand, it would be good to discuss his ideas with others in the community and work with a partner who can assist in defining an objective better aligned with the community requirements.
The project has milestones. But there is no OKR to measure success.

solution: App integration of Daedalus to memory core. Important to improve app experience. Ubuntu $45,000 for dev and updates, Fedora Workstation OS
experience: MCSE. 30 years of code work. Make my own equipment and programming. node #1 and touchscreen #1 are online now and function 100% perfectly.
